tourBios.carHigh: Has made one cut in three career starts on the PGA TOUR. Has also played on the Gateway Tour, DP Tour and the Hooters Tour. 2012: Played on the NGA Tour Pro Golf Tour...Has not made a start on the Web.com Tour since the 2008 season. 2009: Won for a second consecutive season on the Hooters Tour. 2008: Played in two Web.com Tour events, missing the cut in both...Won on the Hooters Tour. 2006: Made his first career start on the Web.com Tour. Made the cut in two of 11 starts, with his best finish a T30 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship. 2004: Won a Gateway Tour event at the Senator Course at Capitol Hill, which played host to the Web.com Tour Championship from 2001-05.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Won the Alabama State Junior Championship in 1991 and 1992. Won the 1997 SEC Championship. Earned All-Southeastern Conference honors for the University of Alabama for three years (1995-97), including first-team honors the latter two years.
tourBios.personal: Lists his dad as his hero. Got his start in golf from tagging along on the golf course with his dad...Attended Bibb County High School in Centreville, Ala...Lists Scott Hamilton as his instructor...Biggest thrill in golf was winning the 1997 SEC Championship. Biggest thrill outside golf was the birth of his son...Uses a 1965-or-older quarter to mark his ball...Favorite websites are golfwrx.com and rolltide.com. Top college team is Alabama and top pro team is the Atlanta Braves...Enjoys "Seinfeld" and movies "Tombstone" and "The Rookie." Favorite book is the Bible. Favorite city to visit is Tuscaloosa, Ala., and top vacation spot is any beach. Has had his putter in the bag for 10 years. Special headcover is an Alabama Big Al cover...Favorite app is for weather...Not many people know that he enjoys mowing the lawn...Bucket list includes making a Ryder Cup team.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was T30th in 2006 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship.
